value.title: Chain Azure Functions together using input and output bindings
value.excerpt: In this module, we'll learn how to integrate your Azure Function with various data sources by using bindings.

value.title: Connect your on-premises network to the Microsoft global network by using ExpressRoute
value.excerpt: Connect your on-premises systems and users to Azure and Office 365 by using ExpressRoute for private, dedicated, and guaranteed throughput connectivity.

value.title: Create a classification model with Azure Machine Learning designer
value.excerpt: Classification is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict categories or classes. Learn how to create classification models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.excerpt: Describe identity principles and concepts

value.excerpt: Integrate data with Azure Data Factory or Azure Synapse Pipeline

value.title: Introduction to Linux on Azure
value.excerpt: Discover the unique benefits of running Linux on Azure, and how to run Linux-based applications and workloads in the cloud with Azure.

value.title: Fundamentals of network security
value.excerpt: Explore the fundamentals of computer networking security and monitoring.

value.title: Prepare to develop AI solutions on Azure
value.excerpt: Prepare to develop AI solutions on Azure

value.title: How to create a virtual machine in Azure | Azure Portal Series
value.excerpt: Azure provides multiple virtual machine configuration options for you to set up your virtual machine exactly how you want for whatever you're trying to do. In this video of the Azure Portal “How To” Series, learn how to configure a basic virtual machine and connect to it in minutes in the Azure portal.

value.title: Align requirements with cloud types and service models in Azure
value.excerpt: Discover Azure's three approaches to deploying cloud resources -- public, private, and hybrid -- and learn the difference each makes in your Azure services.

value.title: Build a web app with Blazor WebAssembly and Visual Studio Code
value.excerpt: Learn how to set up your development environment and build your first WebAssembly app with Blazor, Visual Studio Code, and C#.

value.title: Choose the right disk storage for your virtual machine workload
value.excerpt: Azure provides a variety of disk storage options for virtual machine workloads. Identify the features of capabilities of each type to ensure your application performs optimally.

value.title: Understand virtualization
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University's Cloud Developer course. Take a deep dive into virtualization by understanding its formal definition as well as the different types of virtual machines.

value.title: Connect an app to Azure Storage
value.excerpt: Create a simple application and add configuration, client library references, and C# or JavaScript code to connect it to Azure Storage.

value.title: Describe the identity and access management capabilities of Microsoft 365
value.excerpt: Describe the identity and access management capabilities of Microsoft 365

value.title: Design a holistic monitoring strategy on Azure
value.excerpt: Use monitoring services on Azure to bring operational excellence to your applications and infrastructure.

value.title: Introduction to Docker containers
value.excerpt: Introduction to Docker containers

value.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
value.excerpt: Learn about SRE, an engineering discipline that helps you sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.

value.title: Introduction to Azure virtual networks
value.excerpt: In this module, you will learn how to design and implement fundamental Azure Networking resources such as virtual networks, public and private IPs, DNS, virtual network peering, routing, and Azure Virtual NAT.

value.title: Manage Agile software delivery plans across teams
value.excerpt: Learn to optimize delivery efficiency by improving work plan visibility across teams.

value.title: Protect your virtual machines by using Azure Backup
value.excerpt: Use Azure Backup to help protect the data for on-premises servers, virtual machines, virtualized workloads, SQL Server, Azure Files, and more.

value.title: Store application data with Azure Blob storage
value.excerpt: Discover how to build an app that stores user files with Azure Blob storage, use Blob storage in a web app, and use the Azure Storage SDK for .NET Core.

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Manage services with the Azure portal
value.excerpt: Get acquainted with the Azure cloud platform through the Azure portal, where you create and manage all of your Azure resources.

value.title: Enabling secure remote work using Windows Virtual Desktop | Azure Friday
value.excerpt: Windows Virtual Desktop (WVD) is a comprehensive desktop and app virtualization service running in Azure to enable secure remote work. Christiaan Brinkhoff joins Scott Hanselman to show how WVD is different from other desktop virtualization technologies, as well as how easy it is to implement and maintain.
